topicv3: Agribusiness m1326896 2179,On-farm Livestock m1326879 1954,Agriculture Extension m1325967 1009

abstracts.cdata!:
This is the Implementation Completion
            Report (ICR) for the Second Livestock Project in Mauritania.
            The main project objectives were to slow the deterioration
            of grazing areas and boost livestock productivity by the
            following means: (i) making groups of pastoralists
            responsible for allocated grazing areas; (ii) providing
            better extension services and production inputs; and (iii)
            contributing to the store of knowledge of livestock
            production systems in order to help formulate a development
            policy and plan future interventions in the sector.
            Bank's performance was not satisfactory.
            Borrower's performance was not satisfactory. The main
            lessons learned from the project are the following: (i)
            tapping a community's organizational capacity and
            commitment to decision-making has proven extremely
            effective, and hilds promise for the future; (ii) project
            design should always be kept simple, and when problems are
            encountered during implementation, restructuring should aim
            to simplify even more; and (iii) no project of this sort
            should be attempted unless a comprehensive government
            implementation plan has been drawn up and relevant
            monitoring indicators have been identified.
